alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:11PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado River near Cisco affecting Grand County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near Cisco. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above bankfull conditions through the weekend, with a maximum value of 13.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Action stage is 13.3 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when recreating along/near the Colorado River. Please heed all campground, trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
